design_preferences: Beautiful, unique, and distinctive typography - avoid generic fonts (Arial, Inter, Roboto, system fonts)
Pair distinctive display fonts with refined body fonts for visual hierarchy
Intentional aesthetic direction: pick an extreme (minimalist, maximalist, retro, luxury, playful, etc.) and commit fully to it
Create atmosphere and depth with backgrounds/textures - gradients, noise, geometric patterns, layered transparencies
Use dominant colors with sharp accents - avoid timid, evenly-distributed palettes
CSS variables for consistency and theming (light/dark mode support)
Smooth, organic SVG connections/bridges between UI elements (e.g., flowing shapes between columns and panels)
Smooth CSS transitions and animations for micro-interactions
Unexpected layouts with asymmetry, overlap, diagonal flow, grid-breaking elements
Generous negative space OR controlled density depending on aesthetic
Focus on high-impact page load animations with staggered reveals (animation-delay)
Sophisticated drop states for drag-and-drop interactions
Polished visual details: decorative borders, custom cursors, grain overlays, dramatic shadows
Context-specific character - designs should not feel generic or like 'AI slop'
rejected_approaches: Generic AI-generated aesthetics (overused fonts, clich√©d color schemes like purple gradients on white)
Try/catch blocks for control flow - fail hard instead
Tailwind CSS for styling - use inline CSS or style blocks
Storing state in Svelte stores - use Svelte 5 runes ($state, $effect, $derived) instead
Dragging out tasks with long implementations - keep code minimal and under 50-200 lines per file
Creating new files unnecessarily - edit existing files only
Non-interactive visible elements with click handlers - use proper <button> or <a> elements
Non-semantic HTML that fails accessibility checks
Linear, predictable UI patterns - embrace creativity and distinctiveness
Try/catch for expected errors - use Result/Either patterns or error codes
Broken visual connections - SVG bridges must smoothly connect across boundaries
workflow_preferences: Use agents/workers for implementation work - don't code directly, delegate tasks
Distribute work to multiple agents in parallel when possible
Use beads issue tracker for project management - don't use markdown TODOs
Task format: 'TASK: [description] WORKING DIRECTORY: [path]' with specific requirements and DONE markers
Keep commits atomic and semantic with verb: description format
Single responsibility per file/component - feature-based organization
Keep files under 200 lines/25KB for maintainability
Edit existing files over creating new ones (exceptions: only if explicitly requested)
Minimal changes per task - focus on one logical change
Use native HTML5 features over heavy frameworks (e.g., HTML5 drag-drop over library solutions)
Child_process.exec for shelling out to bd CLI commands
SSE (Server-Sent Events) for real-time updates instead of polling
Browser verification after implementation - open dev tools to check results

Liked filter/search functionality with minimal CSS additions

Appreciated SVG bridge implementations that smoothly connect UI elements

Praised when aesthetic direction was clear and distinctive (not generic)
Appreciated animation polish and sophisticated drop state handling

Real data feeding - important that UI uses actual beads data, not mock data
Description/metadata display - need to show full issue details (description, fields, notes)
Design skill integration - use Claude's design capabilities to avoid generic aesthetics
explicit_instructions: Don't code yourself - use agents/workers to implement tasks
Use child_process.exec to call bd CLI commands
Keep code minimal: <50 lines per API file, <200 lines per component file
No Tailwind CSS - use inline styles or style blocks
NO try/catch for control flow - let errors crash early
Edit existing files only - no new files unless explicitly required
Use native HTML5 drag-drop: draggable='true', ondragstart, ondragover, ondrop
Use SSE endpoint for real-time updates instead of polling
Reply with 'BEAD_DONE: [ticket-id] - [brief summary]' when tasks complete
Test in browser after implementation - verify at localhost URLs
Choose clear conceptual design direction - bold maximalism OR refined minimalism, never middle ground
Add proper semantic HTML for accessibility - use <button>, <a> for interactive elements
Use design skill for frontend work - avoid generic/AI-slop aesthetics
Beads should manage the project - use bd commands, not markdown TODOs
